notes.text:
An update for jasper is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
JasPer is an implementation of Part 1 of the JPEG 2000 image compression standard.

Security Fix(es):

* jasper: Heap-based buffer overflow in cp_create() in jpc_enc.c (CVE-2020-27828)

* jasper: Heap-based buffer over-read in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c (CVE-2021-3272)

* jasper: Out of bounds read in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c (CVE-2021-26926)

* jasper: NULL pointer dereference in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c (CVE-2021-26927)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Jasper toolâs jpc encoder. This flaw allows an attacker to craft input provided to Jasper, causing an arbitrary out-of-bounds write.  The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-27828 jasper: Heap-based buffer overflow in cp_create() in jpc_enc.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
This flaw can be mitigated for the Jasper tool by not accepting untrusted inputs to be processed by Jasper or constraining rlevels on those inputs from outside of Jasper.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-27828 jasper: Heap-based buffer overflow in cp_create() in jpc_enc.c

notes.text: jp2_decode in jp2/jp2_dec.c in libjasper in JasPer 2.0.24 has a heap-based buffer over-read when there is an invalid relationship between the number of channels and the number of image components.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: A flaw was found in jasper before 2.0.25. An out of bounds read issue was found in jp2_decode function whic may lead to disclosure of information or program crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: A flaw was found in jasper before 2.0.25. A null pointer dereference in jp2_decode in jp2_dec.c may lead to program crash and denial of service.
